html: (2 Nephi 17:3)."Shear-jashub thy son." One of two known sons of Isaiah, his name means "the remnant shall return." The reason for the son's presence on this occasion has been suggested by Monte Nyman: "It may have been to remind Ahaz of the prophecy that Judah would not be utterly destroyed, or it may have been a reminder that the Lord had prophesied concerning Judah in order to prepare Ahaz for the prophecy which Isaiah was to deliver." (GAWI, 54.)
